Name: Pleasant
Notes: First significant wildfire of the year

Name: Creek
Notes: 4 residential structures and 7 minor structures destroyed

Name: Pendleton Complex
Notes: Originated as 3 separate fires; burned in Camp Pendleton

Name: Georges
Notes: This was about the time that the wildfire outbreak started and some of the worst wildfires of the season, including the Carr and Mendocino Complex, aka the Ranch Fire/ River Fire, began.

Name: Ferguson
Notes: 19 firefighters injured, 2 firefighters killed; 10 structures destroyed

Name: Carr
Notes:
1,079 residences, 22 commercial structures, 503 outbuildings destroyed
190 residences, 26 commercial structures, and 63 outbuildings damaged
3 firefighters and 5 civilians killed

Name: Mendocino Complex
Notes:
The Ranch and River Fires are collectively called the Mendocino Complex Fire
157 residential buildings destroyed, 123 others destroyed
13 residential buildings and 24 other buildings damaged
1 firefighter killed, 4 firefighters injured

Name: Delta
Notes: Merged into the Hirz Fire; 20 structures destroyed

Name: Alder
Notes: Both of the Alder and Eden Fires, along with the Mountaineer, were the last fires to be taken out. All three were 100% Contained by the end of December 7.

Name: Mountaineer
Notes: This fire, along with the Alder and Eden fires, were the last fires to be put out, marking the end of the fire season.

Name: Camp
Notes: 5 firefighters injured, 89 civilian deaths, 12 civilians injured, 1 civilian missing; 18,804 structures destroyed, 564 structures damaged; destroyed the town of Paradise. Costliest wildfire recorded in the modern era.
